titles.title: Supreme Court Grounds Transfer Act of 2005
Supreme Court Grounds Transfer Act of 2005
Supreme Court Grounds Transfer Act of 2005
Supreme Court Grounds Transfer Act of 2005
A bill to transfer jurisdiction of certain real property to the Supreme Court.

vote.text: Introduced in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management.
Mr. Shuster moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 2116.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.subcommittee: Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management
committee.name: House Transportation and Infrastructure

bill.summary: 4/11/2006--Public Law. Supreme Court Grounds Transfer Act of 2005 - Transfers jurisdiction over a certain parcel of federal land in the District of Columbia from the Architect of the Capitol to the Supreme Court, without consideration.
